content:
IF you are participating in SANER testing and have a server up, please list it here:
@Gino Canessa @Michael Donnelly ?

Symptomatic (Intermediary/Hub)
https://saner.symptomatic.io/baseR4

CDC/National Healthcare Safety Network - Dan Pollock, CDC, dap1@cdc.gov, Austin Kreisler, Ahmed Tahir, Romaine Tenney, Heath Dinkins, Silas Johnson

Endpoint: https://0047-sdc-phi.leidosweb.net/hapi-fhir-jpaserver/
@Hans Buitendijk ?
deleted
https://prototype-erp-fhir.azurewebsites.net/ is [base] for their server. It has no fancy front end.

Cerner doesn't have a server, we're only pushing MeasureReports. So far, we've seen 200/201 from:
Nextgen's Mirth server: http://ec2-34-210-212-20.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com:9001/MeasureReport
Leidos/CDC: https://0047-sdc-phi.leidosweb.net/hapi-fhir-jpaserver/fhir/MeasureReport
Symptomatic: https://saner.symptomatic.io/baseR4/MeasureReport
Azure: http://prototype-erp-fhir.azurewebsites.net/MeasureReport
AI: http://3.82.176.68/fhir/MeasureReport
Fantastic! Thank you

Is the question whether we have a server to ping with SANER data? We had indicated to Keith that we did not have the bandwidth to get that uploaded by the connectathon, rather would be able to work on that after that. Part of the effort is to put the data into the locations where it would be documented in our system, so that requires some effort as this is not a drop-in.

@David Turvey , can you give us the Ids for the MeasureReport resources that you sent to those systems so that we can potentially download them.
Alternatively, can you validate an example of them using Inferno: https://inferno.healthit.gov/validator/ ?

Yeah - looks like there were quite a few validation errors so I'll start running through them.

Nextgen's Mirth server: http://ec2-34-210-212-20.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com:9001/MeasureReport
- http://ec2-34-210-212-20.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com:9001/MeasureReport/e03b67f5-de0f-4ea2-b0ed-93bee0aa0dd1/_history/1
Leidos/CDC: https://0047-sdc-phi.leidosweb.net/hapi-fhir-jpaserver/fhir/MeasureReport
- http://localhost:8080/hapi-fhir-jpaserver/fhir/MeasureReport/2545/_history/1
Symptomatic: https://saner.symptomatic.io/baseR4/MeasureReport
- baseR4/MeasureReport/yiPx9ko7fQHQN235R
Azure: http://prototype-erp-fhir.azurewebsites.net/MeasureReport
- 767ffb19-1b84-4adb-96df-a03bf27f33c8
AI: http://3.82.176.68/fhir/MeasureReport
- ID sent = "id": "CERN-22222-20200817-CDCPatientImpactAndHospitalCapacity", not seeing a response header with repo ID
Some of them may be "our fault" e.g., due to errors in the way the profile was specified. If you have any questions, feel free to jump on Whova to chat interactively or message me here.
David, you have a localhost link in there http://localhost:8080/hapi-fhir-jpaserver/fhir/MeasureReport/2545/_history/1
don't believe in magic, eh? haha

@David Pyke , the "Content-Location" header response from the Leidos server uses "localhost". I imagine the full URL would be:
https://0047-sdc-phi.leidosweb.net/hapi-fhir-jpaserver/fhir/MeasureReport/2545/_history/1
yeah, that's our bad... sorry about that
we'll get that updated...
No worries at all! I can't count the number of errors from the validator on my fingers and toes. I'll be busy for a while but will kick through another when that's done.
test.sanerproject.org is back up with everything that should be there as best I can tell.
i just submitted a measure report to it. it worked. woot

Just kicked a revised one over there as well, @Keith Boone . Still have a bit more adjusting to do on the Subject Identifier but got the 201 back: http://3.82.176.68/fhir/MeasureReport/1947/_history/1
